body: I think it might be better to remove the `_enforce_cudnn` method, and instead check for `cudnn.is_acceptable(input)` here instead of checking for both conditions, as [`cudnn.is_acceptable` already perform those checks for you](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/backends/cudnn/__init__.py#L37-L56)
